Identification and analysis of differentially expressed genes in gene-expression datasets

The Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) is a publicly-funded repository of gene-expression studies maintained by the NCBI. Access the repository here. Example GEO datasets are in the table below

Perform these tasks to familiarize yourself with respect to basis analyses of this type of data. (Note that some of the tasks can be performed using the GEO web interface - see below. However, for the purposes of the workshop perform these analyses yourself in R)

  • Select a GEO Dataset, and follow the links to read about the study
    • Make sure to understand the study and the experimental design
      • What is the objective of the study?
      • What platform has been used and what has been measured?
      • What are the sample groups?
      • How many replicates have been performed, and what type of replicates are they?
  • Data analyses and visualizations
    • (use R code for the analysis)
    • Visualize the distributions of the data (for example using histograms or boxplots)
    • Does the data need to be normalized or scaled?
    • Visualize the correlation between samples (for example using pairwise scatterplots and computing correlations)
    • Use PCA to visualize the structure in the data. Do the sample groups cluster?
    • Compute the ratio (use the log2 ratio) for pairwise comparison(s) within the dataset
    • Identify DEGs within the dataset (use T-test)
      • Note that for the purposes of this workshop we do not do any multiple testing correction
    • Plot Volcano plot(s) using the ratio and T-test p-values
  • Biological interpretation
    • How many DEGs are there with e.g. p-value < 0.05?
    • Identify functional gene networks using STRING
    • Identify enriched pathways and processes using e.g. GOrilla or Enrichr
    • How does your biological interpretation relate to the original study? What could you add to the analysis?

    Using the GEO web interface to identify differentially expressed genes in gene-expression datasets

    See the video tutorial here

    • Select a data set
      • http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/query/acc.cgi?acc=GSE44097
    • Click 'Analyze with GEO2R'
      • http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/geo2r/?acc=GSE44097
    • Define groups of samples (e.g. treated and control)
    • Assign samples to groups
    • Click 'Top 250' to give you list of differentially expressed genes
